question: Bill, you've got to shut this down, now. Tell Brad he can't work with you, period.
answer: No, no. I love his enthusiasm... It's just a little misguided. There must be something he can do for the campaign, where he can't hurt us.

question: Such as...?
answer: I don't know... phones, stuffing envelopes, making signs, something. CUT TO: ... in Bill Gluckman's administration, women will have better health care, women will have better day care, and women will have better jobs! From here on in, my campaign has a new slogan! Bill Gluckman's down with the bitches and ho's'?

question: So... Bradley...
answer: Why you keep callin' me dat?

question: Well that's your name, isn't it?
answer: It's my slave name, a'ight? I told you like fi'ty times.

question: Yes, okay... B-Rad...
answer: Wassup?

question: Let's play an association game. He picks up three CD's, keeping the backs to Brad. Alright, B-Rad. I want you to look at these... He turns the first one around. It's an NWA CD. Next is a Snoop CD, then a Naz CD, and last is Brad's high school yearbook photo. Now, which one doesn't belong?
answer: Shoot. N.W.A., fool. They broke up a long time ago.

question: Oh stop beating around the bush, Bess. What we're trying to say is, Brad, that your behavior is, well, it's an embarrassment to the family.
answer: Yo, Pops, that hurts my feelings.

question: I'm sorry, but it's the truth.
answer: Don't be hatin'.

question: And, Brad... I can't have you on the campaign any longer.
answer: What?! Oh that's how it is? A'ight then. I'm Audi! I need to take a drive.

question: Oh no, not gangsta-phrenia! CUT TO: Bradley, I know you're busy, but we need to talk. Brad lifts his sunglasses and turns to his mother.
answer: What's up?

question: After our therapy session I realized that your father and I could have been better parents. We neglected you and I feel terrible.
answer: For real?

question: Yes. So from here on out I'm going to be a better mother. I want to get closer to you... be there for you. If ever you need -- Just then, her CELL PHONE RINGS. She pulls it out from her hip and answers. Hello? Celeste! When did you get back?! What?! Oh my God! I've been waiting for that bag for six months! It's my personal shopper. Stay right there. I'm on my way! She stands. So... where we... Oh yes. I'm always here for you, Bradley. Do you have my cell number? She hands Brad a piece of paper and exits. Brad pulls down his shades and takes a long sip from his forty.
answer: Gladys?

question: Gladys?
answer: Yeah?

question: Ever feel like you don't belong?
answer: All the time, baby. Most folks only feel comfortable around folks who are the same as them. When they meet someone different, they get scared and angry, wanna keep 'em down.

question: What do you do about it?
answer: Nothin' to do but keep it real. Be proud of who you are.

question: Yeah, you right... Gladys, when they gonna leave our people alone?
answer: I don't know, baby, I just don't know... Eat your greens before they get cold, boy. A PAGER GOES OFF. Brad searches his pockets, pulls out a pager -- that's not it; pulls out another pager -- that's not it either; pulls out a two-way -- that's the one.

question: They car-jack Brad, then take him on a 'tour' of the 'hood... give him a little taste of what thug life's really like. It might just scare the black out of him. Look, I'm as down as the next brother, guy... fellah. I grew up in Compton, okay? But let's get over the P.C. thing and face facts. Unless we do something soon, Brad's gonna cost us this election.
answer: I don't know... it sounds so drastic.

question: Maybe drastic is what Brad needs, Bill. He is twenty-four. I mean, what's he gonna do for a living, rap? They all chuckle. Bill sighs.
answer: Who do we get for the gangsters?

question: You see... 'California is my family'... Cut to angle on Bill and the gangbangers playing basketball, having a wonderful time. If we work together as a family there's no telling how high we can go.
answer: Those are our guys, right there.

question: Will he be safe?
answer: Absolutely.

question: Lemme go.
answer: You don't want to see him like dis.

question: What happened?
answer: He O.D.'d again.

question: Damn. Twelve Frapachizzo's. Brotha's caffeined out. Move aside.
answer: I'ma get mine! Step, fool! I'll cut you, I swear!

question: Just chill, Hadji, we're here to help. What's up?
answer: I... I... I was pickin' up aromatherapy candles at Illuminations for Moms, right? And the counter trick gave me lemon when I specifically axed for lilac! Brad turns to Hadji.

question: It's on now! MUSIC Yo, fool! We got some hard-core drama 'bout to go down right neow!!
answer: Dat's right!

question: He considers himself a 'rapper.'
answer: Frickin' A. They all laugh. Tom hands them a checklist/itinerary.

question: Okay, so here's the story -- it's your basic kidnapping...
answer: So we hold him for ransom?

question: Why don't you have him steal some watermelon while you're at it?
answer: Pays fifteen grand apiece. Good.

question: Wait -- we're kidnapping him, couldn't we get arrested?
answer: Got you covered. Mr. Gluckman's a billionaire -- if you run into any problems with the law, we're very close with the commissioner. On the flip side, if you screw up and a single hair is touched on Bradley's over-privileged head, I will make sure that you do serious time. Clear?

question: Cris... tal.
answer: Good.

question: Congrats, my brother. We just booked another gig.
answer: Yeah, but it's totally dangerous, dude. You know what it's like in the 'hood. We could get shot!

question: We can handle ourselves. Come on, man, it's the ultimate acting challenge.
answer: You know what really chaps my ass? After years of training and study, the only parts they'll give us are gangbangers. Just once I'd like to play a character who has decent grammar and doesn't wear Timberlands.

question: Beats gettin' dunked on by Bill Gluckman.
answer: Do we even know anybody down there? They think, then come up with it at the same time.

question: My cousin.
answer: Shondra. CUT TO:

question: Shondra. CUT TO:
answer: You zooted, nigga?

question: Honest to God.
answer: That's the stupidest thing I ever heard. I got better things to do with my time, boy.

question: Shut up, stupid.
answer: Do this, Shondra. You'll get some real money so you can quit this minimum wage crap and start up your business.

question: What you payin'?
answer: A grand.

question: Make it trey, we on.
answer: Jesus Christ, three grand?

question: Deal. Now how about those fries? MUSIC We're strapped now, my brother. He sets the box down and begins pulling out guns.
answer: They have everything we ordered?

question: Glocks, Uzis, Tec-9s... PJ takes off the cap to wipe his brow, revealing that his hair has been braided into cornrows.
answer: What the hell is that?

question: Oh, my hair? Shondra just did it. What? You hate it?
answer: No. I just think it's a choice my character would have made.

question: Don't go there, Sean. You're just jealous you didn't think of it first.
answer: Whatever. DISSOLVE TO: Okay, got the gangsta wear. What's so funny?

question: That wig, man! I didn't know this was Halloween. Bring me back some candy! He doubles over, falling on the floor.
answer: Whatever. Gimme your ride, punk, or I will dust yo ass!

question: Nope, you're not convincing me. Remember your core character. You're an oppressed black man from the ghetto.
answer: Yeah, I know, I'm having trouble finding this one. Lemme try it again. Gimme your ride, punk, or I will dust yo ass!

question: I'm thin to win! 'The name is B-Rad, Not Robbie Van Winkle... Go get my latte nonfat, And don't forget the sprinkle!' They pound and congratulate Brad on his brilliance. Shondra drops her shades back down and moves in. Hadji sees her first. His jaw drops, then he tugs on Mocha's shirt, whose jaw drops, then Mocha tugs on Brad's shirt. Yo, what up, fool? I'm -- Girl you fly.
answer: Thank you.

question: Let me get them tig ol' bitties.
answer: Word up. She throws open her shirt, and before we see anything we... CUT TO: Coffee. Big... ...black.

question: Yo, Krista the Barista. Put it on my account. Get yourself a blueberry scizonne too, girl.
answer: Cool, playa. She smiles. Brad follows her over to the condiment table.

question: I ain't seen you in here before. Where you reside?
answer: Compton. You?

question: The streets.
answer: Which streets?

question: Malibu... Represent. Bard throws the "M" sign.
answer: Right. I guess it's pretty hardcore up in here.

question: Hell yeah. I'm down with the P.C.H. Hustlers. And dems over dere... Brad points to three white wannabes in another corner. The Calabasis Crabs... and behind dem... We PAN TO another table, where four thug posers sit. ... the Palaside Pimps.
answer: Damn. How do you deal?

question: All day every day. She smiles seductively.
answer: Was that you droppin' rhymes when I came in?

question: Hell yeah, I'm a rhyma on tima... Brad hands her his CD.
answer: Mali-boo-tay, huh? Looks phat. You gettin' any air play?

question: I'm holdin' out for Power 106. I sent Big Boy a CD, he just ain't gotten back to me yet.
answer: Sounds just like that fat fool. I'll talk to him 'bout it.

question: Hold dup? You know Big Boy?
answer: Hell yeah. I see him at the swap meet almost every Sunday.

question: For rizzill?!
answer: For rizzeal.

question: Yo. Holler at him for me.
answer: I don't know. I guess you do kinda got it goin' on... It's funny. I was just on my way down to see him. Wanna roll with me?

question: Now? Well, tonight was my Seder dinner...
answer: Just helping out a brotha.

question: Let's bounce.
answer: I'm just gonna hit the ladies' room, a'ight, pimp juice? She heads off. Brad turns to his posse.

question: Yo, y'all, this fine dimey is hookin' me up with Big Boy hisself.
answer: Shut up!

question: I ain't lyin'! They pound, shake, hug.
answer: Yo, but what about us?

question: Start droppin' beats. Soon as I sign with Biggy, we gonna need some sick tracks.
answer: Bet! They all pound as Mocha starts throwing beats.

question: It's on. CUT TO: So what do you rap about?
answer: Oh, I can rap about anything.

question: For real?
answer: Yeah, lemme kick it freestyle. 'Traffic, traffic, Lookin' for my Chap Stick, Feelin' kinda carsick, There's a Ford Maverick...' See? Dat's a million-dollar song right dare.

question: So, how did you get to be so down?
answer: I been a playa all my life, girl. And I must say, of all the sisters I been wit', you de finest. So, you got a man?

question: I did, but I just got through kickin' his sorry ass to the curb. I ain't nobody's 'gangsta hoochie.' I am an entrepreneur.
answer: Word. What's that?

question: A businesswoman.
answer: Oh.

question: One day I'ma have a chain of beauty salons all up in the 90210, just like Starbucks, only instead of coffee, with hair and nails. Makin' sick money turnin' all the rich hoochies ghetto fab.
answer: That's genius, girl. Damn. You fine and smart too. You gonna blow up huge, no doubt. She's taken aback by his sincerity. She doesn't get much validation from guys.

question: Thank you.
answer: For real, girl. You like a cross between Martha Stewart and Oprah. I'ma call you Mothrah. She gives him a strange look, then notices where they are.

question: Take this exit. Brad swerves across three lanes of the freeway to take the exit, and suddenly finds himself actually in South Central. He's awestruck -- he notices a homeless guy with a shopping cart loaded with bags of stuff.
answer: Yo. He really should use delivery. Suddenly Sean pops his head into the car and stares directly at Brad. He puts a prop Tec 9 in Brad's chest and yanks him out of the car.

question: Yo. He really should use delivery. Suddenly Sean pops his head into the car and stares directly at Brad. He puts a prop Tec 9 in Brad's chest and yanks him out of the car.
answer: Gimme yo ride, punk, or I will dust yo ass... beeyotch!

question: What?!
answer: You're gettin' jacked! Move!

question: Bam! Y'all owe me seven hundred dollars!
answer: A'ight, come on now, let's stop messing around. B told us to lay down some beats for the new album.

question: Lemme go free style.
answer: Free style, please! Your momma rap better than you.

question: Don't you talk about my momma.
answer: I'll talk about your momma all I want.

question: You ain't got the bizalls, bitch!
answer: Oh yeah? Peep dis. Your momma's so poor, when she shops at Barneys, she has to drive herself!

question: All that James Bond electronic crap can't save you now, fool. Sit ya ass down. Brad does, and PJ duct-tapes his hands behind his back. We gonna go call yo daddy.
answer: You better pray he home. If he not, you're one dusted trick! Sean, PJ and Shondra exit, slamming the door behind them. Did you buy my rage?

question: You're indicating.
answer: I'm indicating?

question: 'I will smoke your dumb wigga ass'? Come on.
answer: 'If he not, you're one dusted trick!' Please!

question: You a'ight in here?
answer: Oh yeah. I just been kidnapped, carjacked, hands tied behind my back, but other than that, it's all good.

question: Look, I'm sorry about all that, it wasn't my idea.
answer: I thought you liked me.

question: I do.
answer: Then how come you set me up?

question: I had to. They... ... they threatened to kill me if I didn't play along.
answer: For real?

question: Oh yeah. They straight-up killas.
answer: For Real?!

question: Lemme school you on something, help you to stay alive, a'ight? The one thing they hate more than anything, that really sets them off, is posers.
answer: I feel you, girl, me too.

question: I'm talkin' 'bout you!
answer: Me? But I hate posers! I got a Ph.D. -- a Poser-Hater Degree.

question: Come on. Quit frontin'.
answer: I ain't fron'in'.

question: Listen to reason. If you just be a nice little white boy and say you're sorry, I think I can convince them to let you go.
answer: Damn. I am who I say I am. Why won't anyone believe me? This is a issue that's been comin' up a lot in my life lately.

question: Wigga please! Sean cuts the duct tape with a blade. Come on.
answer: What you doin', fool?

question: I'ma teach this little white girl a lesson!
answer: No, dawg, stick to the plan. Lay low here at the crib 'til we get the ransom.

question: The plan just done changed, Tree. Wannabe claims he down, I'ma show him just how un-down he is. Sean yanks Brad out by his collar. CUT TO: A'ight, Malibu, go get us six 40s of O.E.
answer: And a fifth of Henny. Anything else?

question: Yes?
answer: Yeah, uh, where the Old English at?

question: Back there, under security camera.
answer: Thank you, sir. Brad hurries to the back of the store, and spots a door by the beer cooler. He tries to open it. It's locked. Brad looks up to the security mirror and sees that the Korean Guy is watching him. He moves to the beer cooler and tries to calm down. Namyoho renge kyo, namyoho renge kyo, namyoho renge kyo and whatnot... It's not working. Brad tries a cleansing breath. It doesn't help either. Brad gathers up an armful of Old English 40s and heads for the front. The Korean Guy watches him as he walks past the counter toward the door.

question: Can I help you?
answer: Naaw, but I'ma help myself to all this O.E., and whatever else I want!

question: No, stop. Brad drops the beer. It CRASHES to the floor in SLOW MOTION. Brad makes a crazy, threatening face as he pulls back a fist, but the Korean Guy throws a fast right hand, landing squarely on Brad's chin. Brad goes down like a sack of hammers; then we FLASHBACK TO Can I help you?
answer: Let me axe you something. Ever been robbed?

question: Oh sure. Last week was my fifty- fourth time. But they were cool, no gun to head, never scream; you know, good people.
answer: Cool. He sets the 40s on the counter, then reaches into his waistband for his gun, and we... CUT TO:

question: How much did you have to give this guy, anyway?
answer: What are you talking about?

question: When you set this thing up yesterday, what did you pay?
answer: I thought you set it up.

question: You mean the owner doesn't know this is all fake?
answer: Oh damn.

question: Get in there! He could get shot!
answer: I'm not going in there! You go in there! They continue to argue as we... CUT TO:

question: My emergency stash. Thank you God. He pulls out a hundred and kisses it.
answer: Glad you got cash, 'cause if you try to jack me, I was gonna have to lay you out wid dis... ... and wid dis. The Korean Guy's wife has an AK-47 on Brad, the red dot of its laser sight trained steadily in the middle of his forehead. ... And wid dat. The Korean Guy's six-year-old boy has a sawed-off shotgun pointed at Brad's knees. The gun is bigger than the boy. The Koreans laugh at Brad. Brad drops the hundred on the counter.

question: Keep the change.
answer: Thank you very much. Come again. As Brad looks out to make sure PJ and Sean haven't seen anything, the Korean Guy sticks the receipt in between two of the 40s. Unaware, Brad gathers his stuff and heads to the door.

question: ... a meet and greet with Greenpeace, then drinks with the offshore oil lobby.
answer: Terrific. How's the Brad project doing?

question: Smooth... he's in South Central.
answer: And he's okay?

question: I've about had it, boy!
answer: Who you callin' boy?

question: You got about five seconds to get real, or I'ma Timbo stomp your ass to de curb!
answer: What do you mean, get real?!

question: Act your white self! He shoves a prop gun into Brad's ribs. Five! Four!
answer: Okay, a'ight, chill. Brad takes a deep sigh, looks them in the eye, and begins to talk like a conservative white guy. I guess I now know I can never be as cool as you guys. I promise I will never, ever front or act like a thug again, and I'm really really sorry if I offended you.

question: Yeah, we gonna see what you represent neeow. We at the club.
answer: Cube, Snoop, they all came up through here.

question: You want to prove yourself, this the place to do it. They shove Brad into the club, then turn to each other and giggle like school girls.
answer: This is definitely gonna do it.

question: Pay day! They pound and follow Brad into the club. CUT TO:
answer: How you feelin' now, Malibu?

question: Hey, girl. Where you been? She turns and faces TEC, her ex-boyfriend, a no-nonsense roughneck gangbanger. He's very soft-spoken, almost expressionless.
answer: None of your damn bizness, Tec. Now let go. She yanks her arm away from him.

question: Y'all been busy, huh?
answer: Too busy for you.

question: You been gettin' busy?
answer: Hell no.

question: Come on, girl, I'm cool. Just tell me who it is.
answer: All you need to know is that it ain't you, okay?

question: A-ight, a-ight... We gotta do this. Yo, Saltine... Heads or tails?
answer: Tizzaizzlszzs! Everyone is totally confused. Tails... I want tails. The MC flips and "tails" it is.

question: You wanna go first?
answer: Nah... Ladies first.

question: Whooo... GOD DAMN! Now, let's see if this Eminem melts in yo ass and in your hand.
answer: Can we start again? I lost my place. TAUNTS and LAUGHS as the beat plays again. Brad wags his head, ready to come in strong. He looks down at his notes... He's sweating so badly his arm is a mess of runny ink. He freezes again... The crowd is really on him now -- collectively making the "choke" sign. I'm cool... I'm cool. Brad finally starts up. 'You big and rough, You act all tough, I bet in your childhood You never had much love. Alert the media, I'm a rap encyclopedia, My shrink says I suffer from a case of gansta-phrenia, I'm tryin' to be meania, I'm feeling much vigor, I'm the "Bu's" number one, hardcore NIGGAA!!!

question: I don't care no more. I got nothin' to live for. Go ahead and smoke me. Brad gets in the car. Sean and PJ look at each other -- this isn't what they expected. CUT TO: Huh? Stuart Little?
answer: Negro, pleeeze. That little white rat ain't got nothin' on me -- yo, I'm Ronny rizat, represizzat.

question: I ain't never seen no talking rat before. Although at the Malibu County Fair they had a chicken that played tic tac toe. Man, I hated losing to that chicken.
answer: Why you so down, dog?

question: I'm a failure.
answer: Nah, nah it's not like that. You need to stop listening to what all them perpetrators is running and believe in yourself.

question: For real?
answer: For riz-real. Pound it. They punch it in.

question: So you saying if I put my mind to it I can be whatever I want to be?
answer: Damn straight.

question: I could be a highstylin' pimp?
answer: They stylin-est.

question: I could drive a mad '63 El Camino with 43-inch gold-plated dubs and a trunk full o' bitches?
answer: You could have a roof rack full of bitches. And some teeny-tiny little bitches in the glove compartment.

question: And I could be the biggest rapper in the world.
answer: Rapper? Hell no! You stink! I'd rather eat garbage than listen to your tired ass rhymes. Hmmm, garbage. That's making me hungry. Peace out. The Rat runs off. Brad sighs, flops back down on the bed, utterly depressed. CUT TO:

question: Hey... You okay? Brad sniffles. You know, it's not as bad as it seems.
answer: It's worse. Everybody's right. My rhymes is weak.

question: You just need a little experience.
answer: I should've run when you gave me the chance.

question: Naw. You were right. I respected you for getting' up there.
answer: But you heard 'em laughing. I ain't nothin' but a busta.

question: They just don't understand you. None of them know how hardcore it is up in... Malibu.
answer: Yeah?

question: Yeah with the... traffic, and the... parking, and...
answer: Like, when the public be all up in your private beach?

question: Right. You just got to stick with it, you know, don't let anyone tell you who you are. Brad smiles, looks at her.
answer: Thanks, Shondra. You know what I was sayin', earlier, in the car, about being a playa and all? Well... I was just foolin'. I never been with a sister before.

question: For real?
answer: Except for on the internet.

question: I never would've known.
answer: I think you about the finest girl I ever met in my whole life, and, well, since they gonna ice me in the morning, I was wondering... could I, kinda like, kiss you? She thinks, smiles, then sits down next to him on the bed. Brad sits up and looks at her face in the moonlight. You're so pretty.

question: Thank you. Brad leans in and kisses her tenderly. She kisses him back. Encouraged, Brad opens his mouth wide and tries to stick his tongue down her throat. She pushes him back. I said kiss, fool. Damn. I offered you a snack, not the whole kitchen.
answer: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I'm chill. She rolls her eyes and leaves. Brad falls back on the bed, a dreamy smile on his face. Totally chill. CUT TO:

question: Alright, okay, just relax... As Sean starts to dial, we -- CUT BACK TO:
answer: Yes, Sean. How's our little project going?

question: Great, terrific, we're making real progress here. Your suggestions were really helpful. He totally bought the car jack and kidnapping... ... we staged a fabulous liquor store robbery. Mr. Gluckman's going to be very happy... Brad's eyes widen. But, he's still posing, so we wanted to put him in a drive-by shooting next... but, it's a little more money then our original projections... Brad slumps back. He can't believe it. So I was wondering if I could get an advance.
answer: No deal. You get the rest when Richie Cunningham steps through the door here, and not one second sooner, understand?

question: You feelin' froggy, den leap! Sean backs down. Anyone else wanna step?
answer: What the hell got into you?

question: Shut up, ho.
answer: Who you callin' ho, ho?

question: Get out of the car, white boy.
answer: Oh, you dat weak fuck from de club. Tec can't believe what he's hearing. Got somethin' for me?

question: Just this cap, fool! You ready to die?
answer: Ain't that a coinky-dink? I was just talkin' to my homies about just dat...

question: Move!
answer: A'ight, but y'all should change up your style, cuz these jackings is gettin' tired. He heads for Tec's car. Yo, Bloodbath, if there's one tiny scratch on my ride, I'ma eat y'all's children. Shotgun!

question: Tape up this fool's hole, man. A crew member yanks out some duct tape and tapes over Brad's mouth, then they throw him in Tec's trunk and slam it shut. Tec steps up to Sean and PJ. What should we do with this Bloodbath and his friends?
answer: I'm not Bloodbath! My real name is Sean James, I'm an actor. I swear!

question: Is Shondra hittin' the white boy?
answer: No way, man. She's in on the scam, just like us.

question: Listen, fool. Gluckman's boy has been kidnapped for real, along with your punk friends.
answer: Excuse me?

question: If Mr. Governor wants to see his punk bitch son alive again I'm gonna need five hundred grand by tomorrow midnight.
answer: How do I know this is real?

question: Next stop, the White House. The PHONE RINGS and Tom picks up. INTERCUT WITH:
answer: What up?

question: No deal.
answer: Say what?

question: Bill Gluckman does not make deals with criminals.
answer: That's it, then, fool. I ain't playin'. His ass is done.

question: You do what you have to do, and we'll do what we have to do. He hangs up and smiles.
answer: That's cold. Lose the tape. Tec's homie rips the tape off Brad's mouth.

question: That's cold. Lose the tape. Tec's homie rips the tape off Brad's mouth.
answer: God damn that hurts!!! I get out of this I'ma hafta teach y'all some manners!

question: Your daddy ain't payin'.
answer: Yeah, yeah, tell me somethin' I don't know!

question: What?
answer: You heard me, you half-steppin' moist-ass bitch! Tec cocks his nine and aims at Brad. Oh what, you gonna do me like this? A'ight, then bring it.

question: It's brought.
answer: Man up! Put this wannabe out of his misery. That gat's real, right? Then do it or I'll do it myself

question: Bradley's been involved in a gang shooting.
answer: Are you positive?

question: His face was on the news, Tom! I think I know my own son!
answer: I'm sure there's a logical explanation. Why don't you get some sleep --

question: Sleep? He's shooting the hell out of South Central. We've got to get him!
answer: What about the debate tomorrow in Sacramento --

question: Forget the debate!
answer: If you cancel, you can kiss this campaign good-bye.

question: You can shove the campaign up your ass, Tom! I will not lose my son over this election!
answer: I understand you're upset, Bill, but Jesus, for once in your life think outside the box! We can make Brad's whole gang thing a positive...

question: A positive!
answer: If he's arrested or, God forbid injured, we spin it so you are the victim, you know, 'crime reaches everyone,' something like that...

question: You're trying to get votes out of this?
answer: I'm trying to win, Bill, and you don't seem to care!

question: I'm his father.
answer: When did that happen?

question: I guess right now. Bill grabs Tom by the shirt and slams him into the wall. You're fired. As Bill takes off:
answer: All right, guys, let's pitch on how I get my job back. They just stare at him. Guys?

question: Never mind. He puts an old musty case in the car and starts to close the doors. Hadji stops him.
answer: Come on, let's see it.

question: A'ight, a'ight, chill. He opens the case, revealing an antique blunderbuss musket, with a flintlock hammer and a bell muzzle.
answer: Is that a freakin' musket?

question: Hadji, how 'bout you?
answer: Couldn't get much, yo... Hadji opens a duffel and pulls out three Kevlar vests. When I told my pops we was going on a drive-by, he gave me three of these.

question: Good thinking, but what heat you got? He opens a plastic case, revealing a Stinger rocket launcher and four missiles.
answer: ... dis. Mocha and Monster are blown away.

question: Dang! Where'd you get all dat?
answer: Christmas present from Uncle Ahmet. CUT TO: Hell yes, chicken. I need a location on license number D-

question: Yeah, I just got tested positive ... for G.A.M.E.
answer: That's the same damn line he used on me, and now this no good deadbeat weak-ass white boy won't take care of little Malik.

question: What?!
answer: You know he's yours...

question: Damn, why you throwin' salt on my G.A.M.E.?
answer: I'm savin' your lily-white ass. Come on.

question: I ain't goin' nowhere. I'm a I-9 neow, straight-up. Peep my tat. Brad lifts his shirt and shows her the tattoo on his stomach
answer: Listen, fool.

question: Shut up, Shondra! I know y'all set me up, I know it's all fake, de kidnap, de stickup, de whole nizzy.
answer: Oh, damn...

question: Why'd you play me, huh?
answer: For the money.

question: What you need money Money?! Tch. for?
answer: Look, fool, this may sound stupid to you, but not everybody has money, and to people that don't, money is important!

question: Please. You prob'ly still flippin' me anyway, so --
answer: Dammit, Brad, this is real. Tec and his crew are real --

question: Oh really? Well if Tec is real then this gat must be real... Brad pulls his nine. And if this gat is real then the in it have got to be real. caps And seein' how my foot is real, this would really hurt... then Brad aims at his foot and pulls the trigger and BLAM! He puts a BULLET through the toes of his sneaks. See dat. I just shot myself in the foot and... It's reaaaaalll! It's totally reaaaaalll!!! Brad starts hopping around the room. I just shot my foot!! I just shot my foot!!!
answer: Stop hoppin' around, fool, so I can look at it.

question: Oh gaawwwd!
answer: Lucky you're such a weak shot. Cap just grazed your toe.

question: Hold dup, y'all. Before anybody ices anybody I got to say something. No one stops him, so Brad turns to his dad. You really weren't gonna pay my ransom?
answer: I didn't know anything about that. You've got to believe me, that was not part of the plan.

question: What was the plan? Send me down here to scare me white?
answer: It was stupid, I know. I thought I'd tried everything... I just didn't know how to deal with you anymore.

question: You've never known how to deal with me 'cause you don't know me, and you never cared to find out. And now that your election's on the line, that's when you take a stand? That's bullshit, Pops. Look at me, 'cause this is who I am, and if you can't accept that, then I'll walk out that door, never see your sorry-ass again. Shondra, Tec, all the I-9's and Brad's posse slowly turn from Brad to Bill, completely caught in the moment, waiting for his response.
answer: I'm not proud of myself, Brad. I made a lot of mistakes, and I know I wasn't there for you, and I can't change that, but I always loved you and still do... ... and if you say this is really who you are, then I believe you and accept you, and from here on in, I promise to be a real father to you.

question: Talk is cheap, Pops. Prove it.
answer: I'm here, ain't I? Brad looks at him. Bill looks back. Everyone looks on, riveted.

question: A'ight, Pops, we cool.
answer: Much love. They pound.

question: Would y'all get a hold of your fool selves?! It's time to waste these punks! The I-9s straighten up and re-aim their guns.
answer: Tec, before we all go out in a blaze of glory, can I say one last thing?

question: Whatchya got to say?
answer: Moch, kick it freestyle. Mocha rests the musket in the crook of his arm, and does his human beat box thing as Brad begins to rap. 'What's up with all this fightin'? We all should be unitin'! Y'all egos need deflatin', Gangstas, please, quit all this hatin'.'

question: Stop, please! If I hear you drop one more rhyme, I'ma hafta smoke myself.
answer: A'ight, cool, but all these gats got to go! As Brad grabs the missile launcher from Hadji...

question: Aaah!!!
answer: You alright?

question: I'm cool... still a little confused maybe. I'm still not exactly sure what was for real and what wasn't.
answer: Well, as far as being real, I can only vouch for two things. She kisses him full on the lips.

question: Damn. Twenty thousand people, all here to support my pops. He must have charisma.
answer: Like father like son.

question: Shondra, girl. I just have to thank you.
answer: For what?

question: You the only one who accepted me for who I really am. You also car jacked me, kidnapped me and tried to turn me white, but I'm gonna let that go. They kiss, tongues and all as Bill walks up.
answer: Hey, kids... Sorry to interrupt.

question: What up?
answer: Well, I'm about to go on and, Brad... I want you to be part of this.

question: You mean, be onstage with you?
answer: I need you to help me get the urban vote. Introduce me.

question: Dang, I'd be honored.
answer: And, son, don't say it... Rap it.

question: For real, Pops?
answer: For real, son, for rizzeal. Shondra looks on proudly as MUSIC -- heavy on emotional strings, swells, driving the movie audience to feel as good as they've ever felt in a movie. Brad takes the stage.
